Pivoting Through a Network

Pivoting through a network refers to the act of using a previously established exploited system to aid in compromising another system on the network. Using pivoting techniques can allow for an attacker to move through the network to access other systems. Many different techniques and tools can be used to pivot through a compromised network. Some of the tools you can use include autoroute and portfwd. Autoroute is a tool used to add routes associated with the specified Meterpreter session to Metasploit's routing table. Portfwd is a tool that can be used to relay TCP connections from a compromised machine allowing for access to machines otherwise inaccessible from the attacking system.
